Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Defensin 8 (Defensin-8, natural AMPs; hard ticks, Nuttalliellidae, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 3S=S; UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: nymphs, midgut, Castor bean tick,Ixodes ricinus

Literature.Author: Guizzo MG, Frantova H, Lu S, Kozelkova T, Cíhalova K, Dycka F, Hrbatova A, Tonk-Rügen M, Perner J, Ribeiro JM, Fogaça AC, Zurek L, Kopacek P.2024
Literature.Reference: Front Cell Infect Microbiol. 2024 Aug 13;14:1450353. doi: 10.3389/fcimb.2024.1450353.PubMed
Literature.Title: The immune factors involved in the rapid clearance of bacteria from the midgut of the tick Ixodes ricinus.

Sequence Information.Comments: Host expression:constitutive: not induced and called guard AMPs.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (94.87%) totick PersulcatusinC: 16%, G: 18%, R: 13%. GRAVY: -0.47; mol Wt: 4199.851; mol formula: C176H270N60O48S6; mol ex coeff:  3355.Chemical modification:  C4-C24, C11-C32 and C15-C34.Activity: active against Gram+ M. luteus (MIC 0.008 uM), S. aureus (MIC 1.95 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 0.98 uM), M. maritypicum (MIC 0.49 uM) but not Gram-negative bacteria P.aeruginosa (MIC > 250 uM) and E.coli (MIC > 250 uM).SAR: DTT reduction had not effect on this defensin activity.
